name: steerpike66
text: They're both good but only the British one makes you feel like you're actually seeing reality in a different way. The US one is slick and well-made but it doesn't nauseate you.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
I haven't watched every episode of the American one, but I can say it's defintely had moments that match the British one in terms of embarrasment/unease. I'm guessing that's what you're referring to...?

Still, there's not much point in comparing the American to the British one. While the American one is fine and has only gotten better over time, the original trumps in every category; I have a hard time understanding people who don't accept this (which would be most of my friends).

(I'm sure this is probably some cliched internet argument, sorry to prolong this.)

name: alejandroadam
text: A comment left by alejandroadam was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tekende, fakead, mattbeetee, Courtland)

name: gmm
text: They're both very good, just in different ways.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Yes, but the British one is very good in much better ways.

name: alejandroadam
text: I won't pretend I get the context of half the jokes.  and unless I go live in england I probably never will. I'm sure there could be alot about it that's better, I just can't get past the cultural 'wtf just happened' aspect. not that I don't enjoy alot of world lit, music, film. just for a show of this nature, it's hard to understand the satire out of context.

name: nabeel84
text: There's simply not as many funny jokes as there is in the American version. While it was more realistic (until the Christmas specials) and depressing, it wasn't as funny as the Anmerican version. I personally thought Extras was better Gervais.

name: i_love_kate
text: I personally fucking hate all of it. Feeling sympathetically embarrassed is not funny to me. Laughing because I don't know how else to react to a situation is not laughing for the right reason.

name: alejandroadam
text: ...   fuck yeah.

name: i_love_kate
text:
Also to clarify: I say I hate all of it, but I've never seen the American version. If it does indeed contain "funny jokes" then it might just be out there enough for me to enjoy it.

But for now I'm just going to watch Futurama from back to front over and over again.

text: Especially Bender's Big Score! 1101101...
